result.title: On-chip array of single-photon sources
result.description: The integration of single photon sources can provide a more scalable method for the generation of multi-photon states required for quantum simulations. We will develop a photonic chip that includes an array of single photon sources. The chip will be composed of a circuit to distribute light from the same pump laser to various spontaneous Four Wave Mixing waveguide sources and a frequency filtering stage.

project.title: Quantum Simulation on a Photonic Chip

result.title: Actual & perceived privacy considerations and ethical requirements I
result.description:
FZ is main responsible for delivery, with contributions from NCSR-D, FSL and FHAG.
The report must include an updated literature review containing the sociological, ethical and gender-related projections on medical data collection (M3). It will further describe the impact of these considerations in the design of RADIO and set the privacy and ethical framework of the system, taking into account the target group. (M18)
These deliverables are prepared within Task 2.2 and satisfy Objective 2.

result.title: Report on risk assessment methodology
result.description: A report on the risk assessment methodology developed which that takes into consideration the probability of occurrence of the events (e.g. floodwaters deeper than x meters) to which the infrastructure objects will be subjected and the probability of the infrastructure objects providing different levels of service following an event (e.g. due to a flood the rail line is closed for two days but then reopened without need to execute an intervention, or is closed for two months until it can be rebuilt).

result.title: Description of device-centric authentication (DCA) protocols and technology support (revised and extended)
result.description: The deliverable will describe DCA protocols, user/device and device/server interfaces and APIs, including description of needed extensions to FIDO standards with multi-level authentication and recovery mechanisms. Moreover, it will document how the trusted device execution environment can be exploited for human-to-device authentication, and it will document the implementation of TPM- and Telco-signed behavioral certificates. First DCA prototype implemented. D3.3 will revise and extend D3.1.

result.title: Functional specification of contextual data generation and annotation tools and digital event framework definition
result.description: This deliverable will provide the description of the functionality to be included in the tools to be developed in the first three tasks of this WP, meeting the user requirements elicited in WP1. It will also provide the definition of the digital event framework and of the interfaces exposed to gather the obtained contextual data and to enable sharing and re-use of this rich data related to the picture taken
